intro: Diosma barosmifolia, commonly known as the Barosmi leaf or Barosmi plant, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many species with showy flowers and often milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in shaded, forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
